meanings.definition: Of or relating to the side; situated at or extending to the side.
meanings.sent1: The car's side mirror provided a lateral view of the road.
meanings.sent2: She took a lateral step to avoid the puddle on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent3: The lateral placement of the vase made it look like it was dancing.
meanings.sent4: His lateral thinking helped solve the problem from a different angle.
meanings.sent5: The lateral stripes on the zebra made it blend into the grasslands.

meanings.definition: A lateral pass or movement; a sideways movement or pass.
meanings.sent1: The quarterback made a lateral to his teammate during the game.
meanings.sent2: The soccer player executed a perfect lateral to advance the ball.
meanings.sent3: The lateral of the ball surprised the defenders and led to a goal.
meanings.sent4: Her lateral across the court caught the opponent off guard.
meanings.sent5: The lateral in basketball requires precise coordination among players.
